page.title: 07FARMING 1.
page.content: Agriculture is the predominant land use. It is mainly{dairy {farming}with much of the land intensively managed grass; average acreage 100 - 200; average herd 50 - 100. Cattle are mainly Holsteins (Fresians) bred for milk production. Calves(Hereford/Holstein cross-bred) are reared for beef production and sold at a few months to farmers from other areas. Bulk milk collections are taken to dairies in Manchester for processing and bottling. The milk is stored in refrigerated tanks on the farms and collected once daily. In summer, cattle graze in the open, often watering at field ponds. In winter, they are kept in large sheds (shippons) and fed silage (or hay) and concentrates.
